scenario: Eli Lilly And Co LLY agreed to acquire Scorpion Therapeutics' PI3Kα inhibitor program STX-478 for up to $2.5 billion. The program is a once-daily oral, mutant-selective PI3Kα inhibitor in a Phase 1/2 clinical trial for breast cancer and other advanced solid tumors. As part of the deal, Scorpion will spin out a new entity to hold its non-PI3Kα pipeline assets, with Lilly holding a minority equity interest. The new company will be led by Scorpion's current management team and owned by Scorpion's current shareholders. The deal is part of Lilly's strategy to reinvest profits from its successful diabetes and obesity drugs, Mounjaro and Zepbound, into expanding its drug pipeline. Lilly will pay up to $1 billion upfront and an additional $1.5 billion contingent on meeting specific performance milestones.
